description:
In the Havre du Maison region, a local 
attraction is Butte Ronde, a steep hill with a 
cross raised on its high point. The cross was 
erected in 1913 and a rather difficult though 
short 1.5K trail takes you both straight up, 
and then around its back side, and back to 
the parking area. A rope hand rail has been 
put in place to assist this very steep climb, as 
the path makes a B-line for the top. No one 
thought of switch backs. 

What a spot for a siesta! The cool off shore 
breezes combining with mid summer 
afternoon sun, make lying on the grass as 
attractive as the views of both the rugged 
coast line, the hillocks and pasture land.

The return down the back is equally a fun 
ride. Steep sections combine with gentle 
curves through grasslands and a short stand 
of stunted forest growth. This is a fun, 
though technical little trail.
title: Butte Ronde
